  </td>
  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:8.98%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1.5</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.14%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:9.1%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(4.9</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.02%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:8.78%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1.6</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.58%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="65%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:65.82%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.58%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:8.98%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.14%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:9.1%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.02%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:8.78%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.58%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="65%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:65.82%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net income</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:1.58%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:8.98%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">13.0</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:2.14%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:9.1%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">44.5</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:2.02%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:8.78%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">31.1</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;padding:0in 0in .7pt 0in;width:1.58%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">%</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">28</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='28',FILE='C:\jms\dglaeser\04-3200-1\task94084\3200-1-ba.htm',USER='dglaese',CD='Mar 15 15:23 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Years Ended December&nbsp;31, 2003, 2002 and 2001</font></i></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Revenue.</font></i>&#160; In 2003, total
revenue decreased to $19.2 million from $27.8&nbsp;million representing a 31%
decline over 2002.&#160; The decline was
mainly attributable to a significant decrease in royalty revenue, which
declined to $6.9 million in 2003 from $14.3 million in 2002.&#160;&#160;&#160; Gamecube-related revenue represented
13% of our total revenue in 2003, a decrease from 44% of our total revenue in
2002 as Nintendo reduced its purchases of chips incorporating our licensed
technology for its Gamecube consoles. Royalty revenues from other licensees
increased in 2003 compared to 2002, however, mainly due to increased sales of
royalty-bearing products first shipped in 2002. Licensing revenue also
decreased slightly to $10.4 million in 2003 from $10.5 million in 2002 as we
earned licensing revenue from our new projects started in 2003 offset by the
decrease in licensing revenue earned from the older projects phased out in
2003.&#160; During the second quarter of
2003, we collected $1.0 million in cash from Conexant for the termination of
its October 2000 license agreement with us.&#160;
This payment consisted of current and past due royalty payments totaling
$713,000, and a contract termination fee of $287,000, which we included in
other income.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;In 2002, total revenue increased to $27.8&nbsp;million from
$22.5&nbsp;million representing a 24% increase over 2001. The increase was
primarily due to the significant growth in our revenues from licensing and
royalty activities, which increased to $24.9&nbsp;million from
$9.5&nbsp;million in 2001, a 162% increase. Royalty revenue increased from
$3.4&nbsp;million in 2001 to $14.3&nbsp;million in 2002. Royalties earned from
the sale of Gamecube chips incorporating our 1T-SRAM technology represented a
significant portion, 44%, of our total revenue in 2002.&#160; That represented an increase from 23% of
total revenue in 2001. Royalty revenues from other licensees also increased in
2002 as we simultaneously increased and diversified our licensees and
development projects during that year.&#160;
In 2001, most of the licensing and royalty revenues consisted of fees
for engineering services associated with NEC&#146;s development of chips for the
Nintendo Gamecube video game console and royalties earned from the subsequent
production of Gamecube chips incorporating our 1T-SRAM technology. We also
earned licensing revenue from development projects with a number of other
licensees.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the years ended
December&nbsp;31, 2003, 2002 and 2001, our product sales totaled
$1.9&nbsp;million, $2.9&nbsp;million and $13.0&nbsp;million, respectively.
Sales of our memory chips have declined steadily as we shifted our primary
focus from product sales to the licensing of our 1T-SRAM technologies after
1999. In addition, our product sales fell in 2003 due to significant downturns
in the semiconductor industry and the communications equipment business, which
is the primary market for our memory chips. We expect continued decline in
product revenue in 2004 due to our focus on the licensing of our intellectual
property as the major source of our revenue, which typically produces higher
gross margins than can be achieved from product revenue.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Gross Profit.</font></i>&#160; Gross profit decreased to $16.0&nbsp;million in 2003 from
$24.4&nbsp;million in 2002 primarily due to the significant decline in our
royalty revenue, which has no associated costs.&#160; Primarily for this reason, our gross profit as a percentage of
total revenue decreased to 83% in 2003 from 88% in 2002.&#160; Licensing gross profit declined to 81% in
2003 from 84% in 2002 primarily because we recognized revenue under some lower
margin license projects in 2003.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 2002, gross profit increased
to $24.4&nbsp;million because of the significant increase in licensing and
royalty revenue. Gross profit as a percentage of total revenue increased to 88%
in 2002 from 72% in 2001 due to the significantly higher proportion of
licensing and royalty revenues, which have much higher gross profit margins
than product revenues. In 2002, licensing gross profit as a percentage of
licensing revenue declined to 84% compared to 90% in 2001, however, because our
licensing revenue from contracts accounted for under the completed contract
method declined to 25% of licensing revenue in 2002 from 69% of licensing
revenue in 2001. Most of those contracts were entered into before technical
feasibility was established, and therefore, the costs associated with them were
expensed as research and development expenses before the period in which
revenue was recognized. In 2002, we recognized revenue on the last of the
remaining completed contracts entered before technical feasibility was
established.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 2001, gross profit increased
to $16.1&nbsp;million from $8.4&nbsp;million in 2000 due to strong growth in
licensing and royalty revenues, which contributed $8.9&nbsp;million to the
total gross profit for the year. Gross profit as a percentage of total revenue
increased to 72% in 2001 from 59% in 2000 due to the significantly higher
proportion of licensing and royalty revenues.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 2003, product gross margin as
a percentage of product revenue decreased to 36% compared to 43% in 2002. The
decline resulted primarily from lower average selling prices for our memory
chips in 2003.&#160; In addition, in 2003 our
fixed manufacturing overhead costs were spread over a reduced number of our
memory chips shipped in 2003 compared to 2002. Product gross margin as a
percentage of product revenue declined to 43% in 2002 compared to 56% in 2001.
That decline also was attributable to allocating our fixed</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">29</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='29',FILE='C:\jms\dglaeser\04-3200-1\task94084\3200-1-ba.htm',USER='dglaese',CD='Mar 15 15:23 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">manufacturing overhead costs over a significantly reduced
number of our memory chips shipped in 2002 compared to 2001.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Research and
Development.</font></i>&#160; Our research and development expenses
include development and design of variations of the 1T-SRAM technologies for
use in different manufacturing processes used by licensees and the development
and testing of prototypes to prove the technological feasibility of embedding
our memory designs in the licensees&#146; products. Research and development
expenses increased to $8.6 million in 2003 from $6.6 million in 2002 because we
had increased the engineering staff from our acquisition of ATMOS and to
support our memory compiler development.&#160;
ATMOS&#146;s research and development expenses represented approximately $2.6
million in 2003.&#160; We anticipate a
similar level of research and development expenses for the foreseeable future.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 2002, research and
development expense increased to $6.6&nbsp;million from $4.4 million in 2001
due to additions to the engineering staff from additional hiring and our
acquisition of ATMOS at the end of August 2002. The ATMOS research and
development expenses represented approximately $867,000 in 2002. Our research
and development expenses increased in 2001 to $4.4&nbsp;million due to
additions to the engineering staff, and expanded engineering support of our
licensing activities, including the establishment of the engineering design
center in Seoul, Korea in June&nbsp;2001.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Selling, General and Administrative.</font></i>&#160; Selling, general and administrative expenses increased to
$6.1million in 2003 from $5.0&nbsp;million in 2002 due primarily to increased
sales and marketing activities, including the establishment of a sales office
in Japan in January 2003 and higher professional fees. Selling, general and
administrative expenses increased to $5.0&nbsp;million in 2002 from
$4.7&nbsp;million in 2001 as increases in administrative, sales and marketing
staff expenses were partially offset by lower commissions on product sales. In
2001, selling, general and administrative expense increased to
$4.7&nbsp;million. The increase in 2001 reflected the addition of
administrative, sales and marketing staff and the expansion of intellectual
property marketing activities.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Interest and
Other Income.</font></i>&#160; Interest income reflects interest earned on
cash, cash equivalents, short-term and long-term investments. Interest income
was $1.4 million, $1.5 million and $1.8&nbsp;million in 2003, 2002, and 2001,
respectively. The fluctuation in interest income levels corresponds to
differences in average cash and investment balances for the periods and the
applicable corresponding interest rates, which declined each year in 2003, 2002
and 2001. Additionally, in 2003, other income included the $287,000 contract
termination fee from Conexant and $241,000 of Canadian research and development
incentive tax credits. There was no other income recorded in 2002 and 2001. We
incurred no interest expense in 2003, 2002, and 2001.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Deferred stock-based
compensation cost to employees.</font></i>&#160; During the years
ended December&nbsp;31, 2003, 2002 and 2001, we recorded deferred compensation
cost of approximately $0, $314,000 and $1.5&nbsp;million, respectively, which
cost is being amortized in future periods. The 2002 deferred compensation cost
represented the shares of common stock issued to certain employees of ATMOS
that were subject to vesting requirements related to the acquisition of ATMOS,
which cost is being amortized over the vesting period of 36 months using the
graded vesting method. The deferred compensation cost received during the year
ended 2001 represented the excess of the fair market value of our common stock
over the great price during the period in which the option were granted.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the years ended
December&nbsp;31, 2003, 2002 and 2001, we recorded stock compensation expenses
of $459,000, $656,000 and $1.4&nbsp;million, respectively, of which $211,000,
$582,000 and $1.4 million, respectively, was attributable to the excess of the
fair market value of our common stock over the price at which we granted stock
options to employees. Stock compensation expenses in 2003 and 2002 also
included $227,000 and $74,000, respectively, for amortization of deferred
compensation cost attributable to the fair market value of shares of our common
stock issued to certain employees of ATMOS. In addition, we incurred $21,000 of
stock compensation expense in 2003 due to modification of our 2000 employee
stock option plan related to a former member of our board of directors.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Deferred compensation expense is
bneing amortized using the graded vesting method, in accordance with SFAS No.
123 and FASB Interpretation No. 28, over the vesting period of each respective
option, generally four years. The accelerated amortization results in expensing
approximately 52% of the total award in the first year, 27% in the second year,
15% in the third year and 6% in the fourth year.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Provision for
Income Taxes.</font></i>&#160; Provisions for income taxes of approximately
$279,000, $1.4&nbsp;million, and $367,000 were recorded in 2003, 2002 and 2001,
respectively. The effective income tax rate was 10% for 2003 and 2002 and 5%
for 2001. As of December&nbsp;31, 2003, we had net operating loss carryforwards
of approximately $3.6&nbsp;million for federal tax purposes, approximately $2.6
million for state tax purposes and approximately $13.5 million for Canadian tax
purposes that we expect to be available to reduce future income tax liabilities
to the extent permitted under federal, Canadian and applicable state income tax
laws. The federal net operating losses are subject to an annual limitation of
approximately $2.6&nbsp;million pursuant to Section&nbsp;382 of the Internal
Revenue Code. The net operating loss carryforwards expire from 2005 to 2023. In
2004, we anticipate that our effective income tax rate will be less than the
federal statutory tax rate but higher than the 2003 effective income tax rate.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Liquidity and Capital Resources</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December&nbsp;31, 2003, we
had cash and cash equivalents of $22.0&nbsp;million, short-term investments of
$19.3&nbsp;million and long-term investments of $44.5&nbsp;million resulting in
a total balance of cash, equivalents, and investments of $85.8 million. As of
the same date, the Company had total working capital of $44.4&nbsp;million. In
July&nbsp;2001, the Company completed the sale of a total of 5,750,000 shares
of common stock in its initial public offering. The Company realized total net
proceeds of approximately $51.6&nbsp;million upon the close of the IPO, which
proceeds have not been used to fund our operations to date. Our primary capital
requirements are to fund working capital</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">30</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='30',FILE='C:\jms\dglaeser\04-3200-1\task94084\3200-1-ba.htm',USER='dglaese',CD='Mar 15 15:23 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">needs. We believe that our current focus on licensing and
royalty revenues with reduced levels of memory chip sales has generally enabled
us to steadily improve our cash position.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net cash provided by operating
activities was $4.7 million, $7.9&nbsp;million, and $8.4&nbsp;million for the
years ended 2003, 2002, and 2001, respectively. In 2003, net cash provided by
operating activities was principally represented by our net profit of
$2.5&nbsp;million plus a non-cash charge of $2.0&nbsp;million for depreciation
and amortization, although deferred revenue associated with cash receipts in
excess of recognized revenue declined by $1.3 million.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 2002, net cash provided by
operating activities resulted primarily from net income of $12.4&nbsp;million
plus a non-cash charge of depreciation and amortization of
$1.3&nbsp;million.&#160; Prepaid expenses and
other assets increased by $2.9 million as we recorded deferred tax assets of
$2.4&nbsp;million from the realization of tax benefits through the utilization
of net operating loss carryforwards. In addition, deferred revenue declined by
$1.6&nbsp;million and accounts payable declined by $1.3&nbsp;million. In 2001,
net cash provided by operating activities was $8.4&nbsp;million, consisting
principally of net profit of $7.0&nbsp;million plus a non-cash charge of
$1.4&nbsp;million for stock based compensation. In addition, we reduced
accounts receivable by $1.2&nbsp;million but decreased deferred revenue by $2.6&nbsp;million.
The reduction in deferred revenue in 2001 resulted from the recognition of
licensing and prepaid royalty revenues in excess of additional license fees
collected from our customers.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net cash used in investing
activities was approximately $10.8 million, $29.9&nbsp;million, and
$38.4&nbsp;million for the years ended 2003, 2002, and 2001, respectively.
Aside from investing in short-term and long-term marketable securities in all
three years, we purchased $493,000 of property and equipment in 2003, consisting
principally of engineering design software. In 2002, we purchased
$1.4&nbsp;million of property and equipment consisting of principally of
engineering design software and $12.0 million for the acquisition of ATMOS. In
2001, investing activities mainly consisted of investing in short-term
marketable securities of $36.9&nbsp;million, net and engineering design
software purchases.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net cash provided by financing
activities were $1.8 million, $1.0&nbsp;million, and $54.0&nbsp;million for the
years ended 2003, 2002, and 2001. Cash received upon the issuance of common
stock in connection with the exercise of options and warrants totaled $1.9
million in 2003, $909,000 in 2002 and $2.0 million in 2001.&#160; Also in 2001, we received total net proceeds
of $51.6&nbsp;million upon the close of our IPO.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our future liquidity and capital
requirements are expected to vary from quarter to quarter, depending on
numerous factors, including&#151;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>level and timing of licensing,
royalty and memory chip sales revenues;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>cost, timing and success of
technology development efforts;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>market acceptance of our
existing and future technologies and products;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>competing technological and
market developments;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>cost of maintaining and
enforcing patent claims and intellectual property rights;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>variations in manufacturing
yields, materials costs and other manufacturing risks; and</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>costs of acquiring other
businesses and integrating the acquired operations.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-1.0in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the event Synopsys does not
consummate its acquisition of our company as contemplated by the reorganization
agreement, we expect that our existing capital and cash generated from
operations, if any, will be sufficient to meet our capital requirements for the
foreseeable future. We expect that a licensing business such as ours generally
will require less cash to support operations after multiple licensees begin to
ship products and pay royalties. However, we cannot be certain that we will not
require additional financing at some point in time. Should our cash resources
prove inadequate, we might need to raise additional funding through public or
private financing. There can be no assurance that such additional funding will
be available to us on favorable terms, if at all. The failure to raise capital
when needed could have a material, adverse effect on our business and financial
condition.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Lease
Commitments and Off Balance Sheet Financing</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The impact that our contractual obligations as of December&nbsp;31,
2003 are expected to have on our liquidity and cash flow in future periods is
as follows:</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">31</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating Lease
  Obligations</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.12%;">

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company did not have any unconditional purchase obligations as of
December&nbsp;31, 2003.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Recent
Accounting Pronouncements</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">See
Note 1 of the Consolidated Financial Statements for a full description of
recent accounting pronouncements including the respective expected dates of
adoption and effects on results of operations and financial condition.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><a name="Item7a_Quantitative"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Item 7A.
Quantitative</font></i></b></a><b><i><font style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;"> and Qualitative Discussion of Market Interest Rate Risk</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our investment portfolio consists of money market funds, corporate-backed
debt obligations and mortgage-backed government obligations generally due
within one year. Our primary objective with investment portfolio is to invest
available cash while preserving principal and meeting liquidity needs. In
accordance with our investment policy, we place investments with high credit
quality issuers and limit the amount of credit exposure to any one issuer.
These securities, which approximate $80.9&nbsp;million as of December&nbsp;31,
2003, and have an average interest rate of approximately 1.68%, are subject to
interest rate risks. However, based on the investment portfolio contents and
our ability to hold these investments until maturity, we believe that if a
significant change in interest rates were to occur, it would not have a
material effect on our financial condition.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><a name="Item8_"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Item 8. </font></i></b></a><b><i><font style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Financial Statements and
Supplementary Data</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Reference is made to the financial statements listed under the heading
(a)&nbsp;(1)&nbsp;Financial Statements and Report of Ernst&nbsp;&amp; Young LLP
of Item&nbsp;15, which financial statements are incorporated by reference in
response to this Item&nbsp;8.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">32</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</font>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Quarterly
Results of Operations</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following tables set forth unaudited results of operations data for
the eight quarters ended December&nbsp;31, 2003. This unaudited information has
been prepared on a basis consistent with our audited financial statements
appearing elsewhere in this report and, in the opinion of our management,
includes all adjustments, consisting only of normal recurring adjustments,
necessary for a fair presentation of the information for the periods presented.
The unaudited quarterly information should be read in conjunction with the
financial statements and notes included elsewhere in this report.</font></p>

  <p style="color:windowtext;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>

  </td>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><a name="Item9"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Item 9</font></i></b></a><b><i><font style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">. Changes in and Disagreements with
Accountants on Accounting and Financial Disclosure</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Not applicable.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><a name="Item9a_"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Item 9a.</font></i></b></a><b><i><font style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;"> Controls and Procedures</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Evaluation
of disclosure controls and procedures</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under the supervision and with the participation of
our management, including our principle executive officer and principal
financial officer, we conducted an evaluation of the effectiveness of the
design and operation of our disclosure controls and procedures, as defined in
Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as
amended, as of the end of the year covered by this report.&#160; Based on this evaluation, our principal
executive officer and principal financial officer concluded as of December 31,
2003 that our disclosure controls and procedures were effective such that the
information relating to us, including our consolidated subsidiaries, required to
be disclosed in our reports filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission
(i) is recorded, processed, summarized and reported within the time periods
specified in SEC rules and forms, and (ii) is accumulated and communicated to
MoSys&#146; management, including our principal executive officer and principal
financial officer, as appropriate to allow timely decisions regarding required
disclosure.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">33</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='33',FILE='C:\jms\dglaeser\04-3200-1\task94084\3200-1-ba.htm',USER='dglaese',CD='Mar 15 15:23 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Changes
in internal controls</p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">There have been no significant changes in the Company&#146;s internal
controls or in other factors, which could significantly affect internal
controls subsequent to the date the Company carried out its evaluation.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">34</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='34',FILE='C:\jms\dglaeser\04-3200-1\task94084\3200-1-ba.htm',USER='dglaese',CD='Mar 15 15:23 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><a name="PartIii"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Part III</font></b></a></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><a name="Item10"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Item 10</font></i></b></a><b><i><font style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">. Directors and Executive Officers
of the Registrant</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Directors
and Executive Officers</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The names of the
Company&#146;s Directors and Executive Officers as of December 31, 2003 and certain
information about them are set forth below:</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

</font></div>


<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Member
of Audit Committee</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Member
of Compensation Committee.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Fu-Chieh
Hsu.</font></i>&#160; Dr.&nbsp;Hsu has
served as our Chairman of the Board since September&nbsp;1991 and as its
President and Chief Executive Officer since April&nbsp;1992. Dr.&nbsp;Hsu also served
as our Chief Financial Officer from April&nbsp;1992 until May&nbsp;1996. Prior
to joining us, Dr.&nbsp;Hsu was the President and Chairman of the Board of
Myson Technology,&nbsp;Inc., a developer of high performance semiconductor
products, from August&nbsp;1990 to August&nbsp;1991. From May&nbsp;1985 to
August&nbsp;1990, Dr.&nbsp;Hsu served as Vice President and Chief Technology
Officer of Integrated Device Technology,&nbsp;Inc., a developer of high
performance semiconductor products and modules. Dr.&nbsp;Hsu holds a B.S. in
electrical engineering from National Taiwan University and a M.S. and Ph.D. in
electrical engineering from the University of California at Berkeley.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Wingyu
Leung.</font></i>&#160; Dr.&nbsp;Leung
has served as our Executive Vice President, Engineering, and Chief Technical
Officer and as a member of our board of directors since April&nbsp;1992.
Dr.&nbsp;Leung also served as our Secretary from April&nbsp;1992 until
May&nbsp;1996 and again from May&nbsp;1997 until August&nbsp;2000. Prior to
joining us, Dr.&nbsp;Leung served as a technology consultant to several high
technology companies, including Rambus,&nbsp;Inc., a developer of a high-speed
chip-to-chip interface technology. Prior to that time, Dr.&nbsp;Leung served as
a member of the technical staff of Rambus, and as a senior engineering manager
at Integrated Device Technology,&nbsp;Inc., where he managed and participated
in circuit design activities. Dr.&nbsp;Leung holds a B.S. in electrical
engineering from the University of Maryland, a M.S. in electrical engineering
from the University of Illinois, and a Ph.D. in electrical engineering and
computer science from the University of California at Berkeley.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Mark-Eric Jones.</font></i>&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Jones has served as our Vice
President and General Manager&#151;Intellectual Property since October&nbsp;1998.
Prior to joining our company, Mr.&nbsp;Jones served as Director, Intellectual
Property Division of Mentor Graphics Corporation, a developer of EDA tools and
provider of intellectual property from January&nbsp;1996 to
September&nbsp;1998. Mr.&nbsp;Jones founded 3SOFT,&nbsp;Inc., a developer of
intellectual property and served as its President and Chief Executive Officer
from May&nbsp;1976 to January&nbsp;1996. Mr.&nbsp;Jones holds a M.A. from
Trinity College, University of Cambridge, United Kingdom.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Mark Voll.</font></i>&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Voll has served as our Vice
President of Finance and Administration and Chief Financial Officer since
June&nbsp;2002. Mr.&nbsp;Voll previously held the same position with MoSys from
March&nbsp;1998 to June&nbsp;2000. From June&nbsp;2000 to May&nbsp;2002
Mr.&nbsp;Voll served as the Chief Financial Officer for Axis
Systems,&nbsp;Inc., a developer of semiconductor verification tools.
Mr.&nbsp;Voll holds a B. S. in business administration from Providence College.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Andre Hassan.</font></i>&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Hassan has served as our Vice
President and General Manager&#151;Discrete Products since July&nbsp;2001. Prior to
this, Mr.&nbsp;Hassan was General Manager&#151;Discrete Products from
January&nbsp;1999 to June&nbsp;2001. Mr.&nbsp;Hassan was Director of Marketing
from</p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">35</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='35',FILE='C:\jms\dglaeser\04-3200-1\task94084\3200-1-ba.htm',USER='dglaese',CD='Mar 15 15:23 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">February&nbsp;1996
to December&nbsp;1998. Prior to joining our company, Mr.&nbsp;Hassan served as
Strategic Marketing Manager for S3,&nbsp;Inc., a developer of semiconductor
multimedia products from June&nbsp;1994 to January&nbsp;1996. Mr.&nbsp;Hassan
holds a B.S. in electrical engineering from Worcester Polytechnic Institute.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Carl
E. Berg.</font></i>&#160;
Mr.&nbsp;Berg has served as a member of our board of directors since
September&nbsp;1992. Since 1997, Mr.&nbsp;Berg has been the Chairman of the
Board and Chief Executive Officer of Mission West Properties,&nbsp;Inc., a real
estate investment trust. Mr.&nbsp;Berg has been actively engaged in the
ownership, development and management of industrial real estate and in venture
capital investment for over 30&nbsp;years. He currently serves as a member of
the board of directors of Mission West Properties,&nbsp;Inc., Valence
Technology,&nbsp;Inc., a developer of advanced rechargeable battery technology,
FOCUS Enhancements,&nbsp;Inc., a developer of video scan conversion products,
and Systems Integrated Research Plc, a provider of educational software.
Mr.&nbsp;Berg holds a B.A. in business from the University of New Mexico.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Wei
Yen.</font></i>&#160; Dr.&nbsp;Yen has
served as a member of our board of directors since August&nbsp;2000. In 2000,
Dr.&nbsp;Yen co-founded RouteFree&nbsp;Inc., an audio/video network company,
and iKuni, an artificial intelligence company, and has served each company as
its Chairman of the Board since its formation. In 1997, he co-founded ArtX
Incorporated and served as its Chairman of the Board until 2000, when it was
acquired by ATI Technologies. In 1995, he co-founded Navio Communications and
served as its Chief Executive Officer until 1997 when it merged with Network
Computers Incorporated, now Liberate Technologies. From 1988 to 1995,
Dr.&nbsp;Yen was a Senior Vice President at Silicon Graphics,&nbsp;Inc., where
he oversaw all five product divisions and two subsidiaries. Dr.&nbsp;Yen was
President of Mips Technologies from 1992 to 1993. He currently serves as a
director of the Acer Groups. Dr.&nbsp;Yen received his Ph.D. in electrical
engineering from Purdue University.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Committees of the
Board of Directors and Meetings</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our board of
directors has standing Audit and Compensation Committees.&#160; Carl E. Berg and Wei Yen are the current
members of both the Audit Committee and the Compensation Committee, as the
vacancy created by Paul Russo&#146;s resignation as a director in August 2003 has
not been filled to date.&#160; Mr. Berg is
the Audit Committee&#146;s financial expert, but that status does not impose on him
duties, liabilities or obligations that are greater than the duties,
liabilities or obligations otherwise imposed on him as a member of the Audit
Committee and the board of directors.&#160;
Fu-Chieh Hsu participates in all Compensation Committee discussions and decisions
regarding salaries and incentive compensation for all of our employees and
consultants, except that he is excluded from discussions regarding his own
salary and incentive compensation.&#160; </font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We do not have a
nominating committee.&#160; The board does
not believe that a nominating committee is necessary because all the
independent directors currently serve on the Audit and Compensation Committees,
and any additional committee of independent directors would consist of the same
individuals.&#160; In the event the Synopsys
acquisition does not occur, the board intends to fill the vacancy left by Mr.
Russo&#146;s resignation and to review and approve nominations for election to the
board of directors at the next annual meeting of stockholders solely by
resolution of the independent directors on the board.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the fiscal
year ended December 31, 2003, including telephonic meetings, there were four
meetings of the board of directors, four meetings of the Audit Committee and
four meetings of the Compensation Committee.&#160;
Every director attended at least 75% of the meetings of the Board and
each committee held during the period for which he was a director during the
fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2003.&#160;
In addition, the members of the board of directors, the Compensation Committee
and the Audit Committee acted at times by unanimous written consent pursuant to
Delaware law.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Audit Committee
Report</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Audit
Committee reviews, acts on and reports to the board of directors with respect
to various auditing and accounting matters.&#160;
Management has primary responsibility for MoSys' financial statements
and the overall reporting process, including MoSys' system of internal
controls.&#160; The independent auditors
audit the financial statements prepared by management, express an opinion as to
whether those financial statements fairly present the financial position,
results of operations and cash flows of MoSys in conformity with accounting
principles generally accepted in the United States and discuss with the Audit
Committee any issues they believe should be raised with us.&#160; The Audit Committee&#146;s responsibilities under
the Audit Committee charter adopted by the board of directors effective August
15, 2000 and amended as of February 22, 2004, include the selection or
dismissal of the independent auditors, review of the scope of the annual
audits, and approval of fees to be paid to the independent auditors.&#160; The Audit Committee also monitors the
performance of the independent auditors, and reviews the audit report on the
consolidated financial statements following completion of the audit and the
accounting practices of MoSys with respect to internal accounting and financial
controls.&#160; </font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Audit
Committee Charter as amended to date can be found through our website
www.mosys.com.&#160; The Audit Committee has
delegated authority to Mr. Berg to pre-approve non-audit services provided by
our independent auditors.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the fiscal
year ended December 31, 2003, Messrs. Berg and Yen served on the Audit
Committee for the entire year.&#160; Paul
Russo served on the Audit Committee until the end of August 2003.&#160; The Company believes that Messrs. Berg and
Yen are independent within the meaning of the National Association of
Securities Dealers, Inc.&#146;s listing standards.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Audit
Committee has reviewed and discussed the audited financial statements of the
Company for fiscal year 2003 with management and Ernst &amp; Young LLP
(&#147;E&amp;Y&#148;), MoSys' independent auditors.&#160;
The Committee discussed with E&amp;Y matters required to be discussed by
Statement on Auditing Standards No. 61 (Communication with Audit
Committees).&#160; E&amp;Y provided the Audit
Committee the written disclosures required by Independence Standards Board
Standard No. 1 (Independence Discussions with Audit Committees).&#160; The Audit Committee has discussed E&amp;Y&#146;s
independence with members of that firm.&#160;
The Audit Committee received written confirmations from management with
respect to the non-audit services provided by E&amp;Y and has considered
whether the provision of such services is compatible with maintaining the
auditor&#146;s independence.&#160; The Audit
Committee has determined that the rendering of such services by E&amp;Y is
compatible with maintaining the auditors&#146; independence.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Based on the
discussions with E&amp;Y concerning the audit, the independence discussions and
the financial statement review, and such other matters deemed relevant and
appropriate by the Audit Committee, the Audit Committee recommended to the
board of directors that MoSys financial statements for the fiscal year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2003 be included in its 2003 Annual Report on Form 10-K filed
with the Securities and Exchange Commission.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="50%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:50.0%;">

  the Board of Directors:</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>

  <td width="50%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:50.0%;">

  </td>

  </td>

 <tr>
  <td width="50%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:50.0%;">

  </td>

</table>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Section&nbsp;16(a)
Beneficial Ownership Reporting Compliance</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Section 16(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934,
as amended, requires our directors, executive officers and persons who own more
than 10% of a registered class of the Company&#146;s equity securities to file with
the SEC initial reports of ownership and reports of changes in ownership of
common stock and other equity securities of ours.&#160; Directors, executive officers and greater than 10% holders are
required by SEC regulation to furnish us with copies of all Section 16(a)
reports they file.&#160; Based solely on our
review of Forms 3 and 4 received during 2003 and Forms 5 (or any written
representations) received with respect to fiscal year 2003, we believe that all
directors, executive officers and 10% stockholders complied with all applicable
Section&nbsp;16(a) filing requirements during 2003.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:justify;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Code
of Ethics</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We adopted a code
of ethics that applies to all of our employees. The code of ethics is designed
to deter wrongdoing and to promote, among other things, honest and ethical
conduct, full, fair, accurate, timely, and understandable disclosures in reports
and documents submitted to the Securities and Exchange Commission and other
public communications, compliance with applicable governmental laws, rules and
regulations, the prompt internal reporting of violations of the code to an
appropriate person or persons identified in the code and accountability for
adherence to such code.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The code of ethics
is available on our website www.mosys.com.&#160;
If we make any substantive amendments to the code of ethics or grant any
waiver, including any implicit waiver, from a provision of the code to our
Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer or Corporate Controller, or
persons performing similar functions, where such amendment or waiver is
required to be disclosed under applicable SEC rules, we intend to disclose the
nature of such amendment or waiver on our website.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><a name="Item11_ExecutiveCompensation"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Item 11. Executive Compensation</font></i></b></a></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Summary
Compensation Table</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following
Summary Compensation Table sets forth summary information as to compensation
received by our Chief Executive Officer and each of the four other most highly
compensated persons who were serving as executive officers of the Company as of
December&nbsp;31, 2003.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
