<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

</font></div>


<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">* Mr. Voll became an
executive officer in June 2002.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Option
Grants in Last Fiscal Year</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following
table provides information regarding the grant of stock options during fiscal
year 2003 to the named executive </font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">36</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='36',FILE='C:\jms\dglaeser\04-3200-1\task94084\3200-1-ba.htm',USER='dglaese',CD='Mar 15 15:23 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">officers.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="27%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:27.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" rowspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Number of<br>
  securities<br>
  underlying<br>
  options<br>
  granted (1)</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" rowspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">% of total<br>
  options<br>
  granted to<br>
  employees in<br>
  2003 (2)</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" colspan="2" rowspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Exercise<br>

  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6.89</font></p>
  </td>

  <td width="195" style="border:none;"></td>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left">

</font></div>


<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Options
are incentive stock options to the extent qualified and nonstatutory options
otherwise. All of the options have a 10-year term and generally terminate if
not exercised with 90&nbsp;days following the executive&#146;s employment with the
Company or the expiration date, whichever occurs earlier. Each of the named
executive officers in the table received an option grant under the 2000
Employee Stock Option Plan on September 2, 2003. Those options vest as to 25%
of the shares subject to each option on the first anniversary of the grant date
and 1/36<sup>th</sup> of the shares subject to each option vest monthly
thereafter. In addition, on April 16, 2003 each of such named executive
officers received additional options under the 2000 Employee Stock Option Plan
as bonuses for the Company&#146;s performance as measured against certain
pre-established performance goals for each officer. The bonus stock options
were immediately vested as to 50% of the shares of Common Stock on the grant
date. The remaining option shares vest ratably each month over the two-year
period following the grant date, subject to continued service.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The
percentage of total options granted is based upon options to purchase an aggregate
of 1,065,624 shares of Common Stock granted during the fiscal year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2003 to Company employees, including the named executive
officers and outside Directors.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>All
options were granted at an exercise price equal to the fair market value of the
Company&#146;s Common Stock on the grant date. Fair market value for the two groups
of option grants was equal to the closing price on the NASDAQ National Market
on April 16, 2003 and September 2, 2003, respectively.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(4)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Potential
realizable value has been calculated by assuming that the market price of the
Common Stock appreciates 5% and 10% each year from the date of grant of the
options until the expiration of the options. These assumed annual rates of
appreciation were used in compliance with the rules of the SEC and are not
intended to forecast future price appreciation of the Common Stock. The actual
value realized from the options could be substantially higher or lower than the
values reported above, depending upon the future appreciation or depreciation
of the Common Stock during the option period and the timing of the exercise of
the options. Unless the executive officer remains employed until he vests in
the option shares and the market price of the Common Stock appreciates over the
option term, no value will be realized from the option grants made to the
executive officers.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Aggregated
Option Exercises in Last Fiscal Year and Fiscal Year-End Values</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following
table provides information regarding the aggregate exercises of options by each
of the named executive officers. In addition, this table includes the number of
shares covered by both exercisable and unexercisable stock options as of
December&nbsp;31, 2003, and the value of &#147;in-the-money&#148; options, which values
represent the positive spread between the exercise price of any such options
and the fiscal year-end value of the Company&#146;s Common Stock.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">

  </td>
  <td width="11%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.44%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">958</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.1%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr height="0">
  <td width="119" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="82" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="9" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="73" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="82" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="82" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="9" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="73" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="16" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="9" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="73" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="8" style="border:none;"></td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">37</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='37',FILE='C:\jms\dglaeser\04-3200-1\task94084\3200-1-ba.htm',USER='dglaese',CD='Mar 15 15:23 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left">

</font></div>


<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Value
based on the fair market value of Common Stock on the date of exercise less the
option exercise price.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Pursuant
to the option agreements for option grants made under the Company&#146;s 1996 Stock
Plan, the option holders were entitled to elect to exercise all or any part of
their vested and unvested options at any time. Any shares of Common Stock
received by the optionee on exercise of unvested options become subject to the
Company&#146;s right of repurchase pursuant to a restricted stock purchase
agreement. The number of shares so obtained that are subject to the Company&#146;s
right of repurchase decreases over time in accordance with the vesting schedule
applicable to the unvested options exercised. Accordingly, all options granted
to the named executive officers under the 1996 plan are deemed to be
exercisable for the purpose of the following table, even though
Messrs.&nbsp;Hsu, Leung, Jones and Hassan had 4,687, 4,167, 3,750, and 3,021
unvested shares, respectively, subject to repurchase at December&nbsp;31, 2003.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Value
based on the fair market value of Common Stock of $8.57 on December&nbsp;31,
2003, less the option exercise price.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Employment
Contracts, Termination of Employment and Change-in-Control Agreements</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We currently have
confidentiality and invention assignment agreements in place with the named
executive officers. We do not, however, have any compensatory plan or
arrangement with the named executive officers that is activated upon the
resignation, termination or retirement of any of these executive officers, upon
a change in control of our company, or upon a change in the named executive
officer&#146;s responsibilities following a change in control.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Compensation
of Directors</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 2003, members
of our board of directors did not receive compensation for their services as
directors. In August&nbsp;2000, we granted options to purchase 10,000 shares of
common stock to Mr.&nbsp;Berg for the years beginning in each March of 1997
through 2002 under our 1996 Stock Option Plan. We granted options to purchase
10,000 shares of common stock in each of five consecutive years to Dr.&nbsp;Yen
for the years beginning in each August from 2000 through 2004. All of these
options vest during each year at a rate of approximately 833 shares each month.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our 2000 Employee
Stock Option Plan provides that options will be granted to non-employee
directors pursuant to an automatic, nondiscretionary grant mechanism. Each
non-employee director receives automatically a grant of an option to purchase
10,000 shares of common stock each year at an exercise price set at the fair
market value of the Common Stock on the date of grant. These options vest at a
rate of approximately 833 shares each month. Pursuant to this provision the
Company granted options in 2003 to Mr.&nbsp;Berg to purchase 10,000 shares of
Common Stock, which options begin vesting in March&nbsp;2005, and 10,000 shares
of common stock to Dr.&nbsp;Yen, which options begin vesting in
August&nbsp;2006. No additional options will be granted to non-employee
directors for service during any year in which the director has already been
granted options in a like or greater number.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Compensation
Committee Interlocks and Insider Participation</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Compensation
Committee of the board of directors is responsible for determining salaries,
incentives and other forms of compensation for directors, officers and other
employees, and administers our incentive compensation and benefit plans.&#160; During 2003, none of our executive officers
served as a member of the board of directors or compensation committee of any
entity that had one or more of its executive officers serving as a member of
our board of directors or Compensation Committee.&#160; Neither Mr. Berg nor Mr. Yen was an officer or employee of ours
during 2003, or at any other time.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Report
on Executive Compensation by the Compensation Committee of the Board of
Directors</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Compensation
Committee currently is comprised of independent members of the board of
directors.&#160; The board of directors has
delegated to the Compensation Committee responsibility for reviewing,
recommending and approving our compensation policies and benefits
programs.&#160; The Compensation Committee
also has the principal responsibility for the administration of our stock
plans, including approving stock option grants to executive officers.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Compensation Philosophy</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our executive
compensation policy is designed to attract and retain qualified executive
personnel by providing executives with a competitive total compensation package
based in large part on the executive&#146;s contribution to our financial and
operational success, the executive&#146;s personal performance and increases in
stockholder value as measured by our stock price.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Compensation
Program</font></b></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The compensation
package for our executive officers comprises the following three components:</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Base
Salary</font></i>.&#160; The Compensation
Committee determines the base salary of each executive based on the executive&#146;s
scope of responsibility, past accomplishments and experience and personal
performance, internal comparability considerations and data regarding the
prevailing compensation levels for comparable positions in relevant competing
executive labor markets.&#160; The
Compensation Committee may give different weight to each of these factors for
each executive, as it deems appropriate.&#160;
In selecting comparable companies for the purpose of setting competitive
compensation for executives, the Compensation Committee considers many factors
not directly associated with stock price performance, such as geographic
location, annual revenue and profitability, organizational structure, development
stage and market capitalization.</p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Annual
Incentive Compensation</font></i>.&#160;
In 2003 and prior years, each of the executive officers could earn
annual bonuses set at a percentage of his or her base salary on the basis of
MoSys' performance as measured against certain pre-established performance
measures, principally revenues, and the attainment of individual objectives set
for each officer, other than the CEO, based upon the CEO&#146;s
recommendations.&#160; The Compensation
Committee established the performance objectives for the CEO.&#160; Based on performance against their
objectives certain executive officers did receive bonus payments in 2003.</p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Stock
Options</font></i>.&#160; The
Compensation Committee believes that granting stock options to executives and
other key employees on an ongoing basis gives them a strong incentive to
maximize stockholder value and aligns their interests with those of other
stockholders.&#160; The Compensation
Committee determines stock option grants under the 2000 Employee Stock Option
Plan to all MoSys executive officers and employees.&#160; In determining the size of stock option grants under the annual
bonus program for officers, the Compensation Committee takes into account the
executive&#146;s current position with and responsibilities in setting the annual
target grant.&#160; The percentage of the
target grant awarded to the officer depends upon MoSys' performance against
specified revenue, net income and &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">38</font></p>


<div align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='38',FILE='C:\jms\dglaeser\04-3200-1\task94084\3200-1-ba.htm',USER='dglaese',CD='Mar 15 15:23 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">intellectual property
licensing revenue objectives for each half of the fiscal year.&#160; Generally, each stock option grant allows
the executive to purchase shares of the common stock at a price per share equal
to the market price on the date the option is granted, but the Compensation Committee
has the power to grant options at a lower price if considered appropriate under
the circumstances.&#160; Each stock option
grant generally becomes exercisable, or vests, in installments over time,
contingent upon the executive&#146;s continued employment with MoSys.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 2003, the
Compensation Committee approved stock bonus grants under the 2000 Employee
Stock Option Plan to certain executive officers based upon MoSys' performance
as measured against certain pre-established performance goals for each officer
during the second half of 2002.&#160; Those options
vest 50% immediately and the remaining 50% vests monthly over two years.&#160; The exercise price was equal to the fair
market value of the common stock on the grant date.&#160; The Compensation Committee has determined that executive
officers, including the CEO, will not be eligible to receive bonus option
grants with respect to MoSys' performance during fiscal 2003.</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Compensation
of Chief Executive Officer</font></i>.&#160;
In 2003, the compensation for Fu-Chieh Hsu, the CEO, was comprised of
the three components described above, and is reviewed annually.&#160; In setting Dr. Hsu&#146;s compensation package
for fiscal year 2003, the Compensation Committee intended to provide a base
salary competitive with that paid to other chief executive officers in
competing executive labor markets, and to make a significant portion of the
total compensation package contingent upon MoSys' financial and operational
performance.&#160; During the fiscal year,
Dr. Hsu received a base salary of $279,108.&#160;
Dr. Hsu was awarded a total cash bonus of approximately $72,663 based
primarily on the achievement of financial and operational targets.</p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Compliance
with Internal Revenue Code Section 162(m)</font></i>.&#160; Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code
generally disallows a tax deduction to publicly-held companies for compensation
paid to certain executive officers, to the extent that compensation paid to the
officer exceeds $1 million during MoSys' taxable year.&#160; The compensation paid to MoSys' executive
officers for the year ended December 31, 2003 did not exceed the $1 million
limit per officer.&#160; In addition, the
MoSys employee stock option plans and executive incentive option grants have
been structured so that any compensation deemed paid to an executive officer in
connection with the exercise of his or her outstanding options with an exercise
price per share equal to the fair market value per share of the common stock on
the grant date will qualify as performance-based compensation that will not be
subject to the $1 million limitation.&#160;
The Compensation Committee does not expect to take any action at this
time to modify cash compensation payable to the executive officers to avoid the
application of Section 162(m).</p>

<p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="55%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:55.16%;">
  <p align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="44%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:44.84%;">
  <p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Compensation
  Committee of the Board of Directors:</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="55%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:55.16%;">
  <p align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="44%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:44.84%;">
  <p align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="55%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:55.16%;">
  <p align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="44%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:44.84%;">
  <p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Carl E. Berg</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="55%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:55.16%;">
  <p align="left" style="color:windowtext;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="44%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:44.84%;">
  <p align="left" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Wei Yen</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><a name="Item12_"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Item 12.</font></i></b></a><b><i><font style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;"> Security Ownership of Certain
Beneficial Owners and Management</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following
table sets forth certain information as of February&nbsp;23, 2004, concerning
the ownership of common stock by (i)&nbsp;each stockholder of known by us to be
the beneficial owner of more than 5% of the outstanding shares of Common Stock,
(ii)&nbsp;each current member of the board of directors, (iii)&nbsp;each
executive officer named in the Summary Compensation Table appearing under
&#147;Executive Compensation,&#148; above and (iv)&nbsp;all current directors and executive
officers as a group.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Beneficial
ownership is determined in accordance with Rule&nbsp;13d-3 of the Securities
Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, and includes all shares over which the
beneficial owner exercises voting or investment power. Options and warrants to
purchase common stock that are presently exercisable or exercisable within
60&nbsp;days of February&nbsp;23, 2004 and are included in the total number of
shares beneficially owned for the person holding those options or warrants are
considered outstanding for the purpose of calculating percentage ownership of
the particular holder. We have relied on information supplied by its officers,
directors and certain stockholders and on information contained in filings with
the SEC. Except as otherwise indicated, and subject to community property laws
where applicable, we believe, based on information provided by these persons,
that the persons named in the table have sole voting and investment power with
respect to all shares of common stock shown as beneficially owned by them.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">39</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left">

</font></div>


<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Represents
holdings of less than one percent.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Unless
indicated otherwise, the address of each person listed in the table is c/o
Monolithic System Technology,&nbsp;Inc., 1020 Stewart Drive, Sunnyvale,
California 94085.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The
percentage of beneficial ownership is based on 30,767,544 shares of common
stock outstanding as of February&nbsp;23, 2004 and excluding all shares of
common stock issuable upon the exercise of outstanding options other than the
shares so issuable upon the exercise of options held and exercisable within
60&nbsp;days of February&nbsp;23, 2004 by the named person.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; According to a Schedule 13G filed
with the Securities and Exchange Commission on February 12, 2004 by Wellington
Management Company, LLP (&#147;WMC&#148;), in its capacity as an investment advisor.&#160; WMC has reported that the 2,804,500 shares
are owned of record by its clients.&#160; WMC
has reported that it has shared power to vote or direct the vote of 1,519,100
shares and shared power to dispose or direct the disposition of 2,804,500
shares.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(4)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Clyde
J. Berg is Carl E. Berg&#146;s brother, and Carl Berg&#146;s adult daughter is the sole
beneficiary of this trust. These shares were shares distributed by West Coast
Venture Capital Limited, L.P. (&#147;West Coast&#148;) in connection with the liquidation
of West Coast, effective June&nbsp;2002. Mr.&nbsp;Berg disclaims beneficial
ownership of all these shares.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(5)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; According to a Schedule 13G filed
with the Securities and Exchange Commission on February 13, 2004 by Putnam, LLC
d/b/a Putnam Investments (&#147;PI&#148;), on behalf of itself and Marsh &amp; McLennan
Companies, Inc. (&#147;MMC&#148;), Putnam Investment Management, LLC (&#147;PIM&#148;) and The
Putnam Advisory Company, LLC (&#147;PAC&#148;).&#160;
PI, which is a wholly-owned subsidiary of MMC, wholly owns two
registered investment advisers:&#160; (a)
PIM, which is the investment advisor to the Putnam family of mutual funds, and
(b) PAC, which is the investment advisor to Putnam&#146;s institutional
clients.&#160; According to the Schedule
13G:&#160; (i)&nbsp;PI has shared voting
power over 1,087,783 shares and shared dispositive power over 1,842,443 shares,
(ii)&nbsp;PIM has shared dispositive power over 588,050 shares, and (iii)&nbsp;PAC
has shared voting power over 1,087,783 shares and shared dispositive power over
1,254,393 shares.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(6)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Includes
480,000 shares of common stock held by Dr.&nbsp;Hsu as trustee for trusts
established for the benefit of Dr.&nbsp;Hsu&#146;s children and 40,000 shares of
common stock held directly by such children.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(7)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Includes
600,000 shares of common stock held by Dr.&nbsp;Leung as trustee of trusts
established for the benefit of Dr.&nbsp;Leung&#146;s children.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(8)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Includes
124,998 shares held by Berg&nbsp;&amp; Berg Enterprises, LLC, of which
Mr.&nbsp;Berg is the sole manager. These shares were distributed by West Coast
in connection with its liquidation, effective June&nbsp;2002. Mr.&nbsp;Berg
disclaims beneficial ownership of these shares, except to the extent of his
pecuniary interest in them. Also includes 4,998 shares owned by Mr.&nbsp;Berg&#146;s
wife. Mr.&nbsp;Berg disclaims beneficial ownership of these shares.</p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">40</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>

<h1 style="color:windowtext;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;line-height:normal;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:0pt;">Equity Compensation Plan Information</font></b></h1>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

not have any equity compensation plans that have not been approved by our
security holders.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left">

</font></div>


<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Consists
of 3,712,000 shares of Common Stock available for future issuance under the
2000 Employee Stock Option Plan and 298,000 shares of Common Stock available
for future issuance under the 2000 Employee Stock Purchase Plan, in each case
as of December&nbsp;31, 2003. In addition, the 2000 Employee Stock Option Plan
provides for an annual increase in the number of shares reserved under the plan
on January&nbsp;1 of each year, equal to the lesser of 500,000 shares, two
percent of the Company&#146;s outstanding shares of Common Stock on such date or a
lesser amount determined by the Board of Directors. The 2000 Employee Stock
Purchase Plan provides for an annual increase in the number of shares reserved
under the plan on January&nbsp;1 of each year, equal to the lesser of 100,000
shares, one percent of the outstanding shares of Common Stock on such date or a
lesser amount determined by the Board of Directors.</p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><a name="Item13_"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Item 13.</font></i></b></a><b><i><font style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;"> Certain Relationships and Related
Transactions</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Since January&nbsp;1, 2003, we have not entered into any material
transaction with any of our directors, executive officers or holders of more
than 5% of the common stock, or with any persons in which directors, named
executive officers or such stockholders have direct or indirect material
interests.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><a name="Item14"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Item 14</font></i></b></a><b><i><font style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">. Accountant Fees and Services</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Audit Committee meets
with Ernst&nbsp;&amp; Young LLP (&#147;E&amp;Y&#148;) several times a year. At such
times, the Audit Committee reviews both audit and non-audit services performed
by E&amp;Y as well as the fees charged for such services. The Audit Committee
has delegated its authority to the chairman of the Audit Committee to
preapprove requests for non-audit services. Among other things, the Audit Committee
or the chairman of the Committee examines the effect that performance of
non-audit services may have upon the independence of the auditors.</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.25in;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Fees Incurred by the Company for Ernst&nbsp;&amp; Young LLP</font></b></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">The
following table shows the fees paid or accrued (in thousands) by us for the
audit and other services provided by Ernst&nbsp;&amp; Young LLP for fiscal 2003
and 2002. During the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2003 and 2002, no fees
were billed by E&amp;Y for information technology consulting.</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">105</font></p>

<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left">

</font></div>


<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1) &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Audit
fees represent fees for professional services provided in connection with the
audit of our financial statements and review of our quarterly financial
statements.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2) &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Audit-related
fees consisted primarily of accounting consultations for 2003. For 2002,
audit-related fees include fees in connection with the acquisition of ATMOS and
other accounting related consultations.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 38.25pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3) &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Tax
fees consisted primarily of income tax compliance and related tax services.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">41</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

</font>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><a name="PartIv"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Part IV</font></b></a></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><a name="Item15_"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Item 15. </font></i></b></a><b><i><font style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Exhibits, Financial Statement
Schedules and Reports on the Form&nbsp;8K</font></i></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The
following documents are filed as part of this report:</p>

Statements and Report of Ernst&nbsp;&amp; Young LLP Independent Auditors, which
are set forth in the index to Consolidated Financial Statements on pages F-1
through F-30 of this report.</p>

  </td>
  <td width="5%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:5.34%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">##</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="86%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:86.28%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Form of Stockholder
  Agreement, dated February 23, 2004, among Synopsys, Inc., Mountain
  Acquisition Sub, Inc., a wholly owned subsidiary of Synopsys, Inc., and the
  stockholder of Monolithic System Technology, Inc.</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>

  <td width="6%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:6.62%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.1</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:1.76%;">

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><a name="Signatures"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">SIGNATURES</font></b></a></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pursuant to the requirements of the Section&nbsp;13 or 15(d) of the
Securities Exchange Act of 1934, the Registrant has duly caused this report to
be signed on its behalf by the undersigned, thereunto duly authorized, on the
12th day of March&nbsp;2004.</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="44%" valign="top" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in .7pt 0in .7pt;width:44.58%;">

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">POWER OF ATTORNEY</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS, that each person whose signature
appears below constitutes and appoints Fu-Chieh Hsu and Mark Voll, and each of
them, as his true and lawful attorneys-in-fact and agents, with full power of
substitution and resubstitution, for him and in his name, place and stead, in
any and all capacities, to sign any and all amendments to his Report on
Form&nbsp;10-K, and to file the same, with all exhibits thereto, and other documents
in connection therewith, with the Securities and Exchange Commission, granting
unto said attorneys-in-fact and agents, and each of them, full power and
authority to do and perform each and every act and thing requisite and
necessary to be done in connection therewith, as fully to all intents and
purposes as he might or could do in person, hereby ratifying and confirming all
that said attorneys-in-fact and agents, or any of them, or their or his
substitute or substitutes, may lawfully do or cause to be done by virtue
hereof.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pursuant to the requirements of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934,
this report has been signed below by the following persons on behalf of the
registrant and in the capacities and on the dates indicated.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">i</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='i',FILE='C:\jms\eadrian\04-3200-1\task93892\3200-1-bc.htm',USER='eadrian',CD='Mar 15 13:35 2004' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><a name="ReportOfIndependentAuditors"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">REPORT OF
INDEPENDENT AUDITORS</font></b></a></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">The
Board of Directors and Stockholders of</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Monolithic
System Technology,&nbsp;Inc.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">We have audited the accompanying consolidated
balance sheets of Monolithic System Technology,&nbsp;Inc. as of
December&nbsp;31, 2003 and 2002, and the related consolidated statements of
income, stockholders&#146; equity, and cash flows for each of the three years in the
period ended December&nbsp;31, 2003. Our audits also included the financial
statement schedule listed in the Index at Item 15(a). These financial
statements and schedule are the responsibility of the Company&#146;s management. Our
responsibility is to express an opinion on these financial statements and
schedule based on our audits.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">We conducted our audits in accordance with
auditing standards generally accepted in the United States. Those standards
require that we plan and perform the audits to obtain reasonable assurance
about whether the financial statements are free of material misstatement. An
audit includes examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and
disclosures in the financial statements. An audit also includes assessing the
accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management, as
well as evaluating the overall financial statement presentation. We believe
that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">In our opinion, the financial statements referred
to above present fairly, in all material respects, the consolidated financial
position of Monolithic System Technology,&nbsp;Inc. at December&nbsp;31, 2003
and 2002, and the consolidated results of their operations and their cash flows
for each of the three years in the period ended December&nbsp;31, 2003, in
conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States.
Also, in our opinion, the related financial statement schedule, when considered
in relation to the basic financial statements taken as a whole, presents fairly
in all material respects the information set forth therein.</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">

  <p align="center" style="color:windowtext;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>

  <p style="color:windowtext;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>

  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">ERNST
  &amp; YOUNG LLP</font></p>
  </td>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-1</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">

</font>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">MONOLITHIC
SYSTEM TECHNOLOGY,&nbsp;INC.</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><a name="ConsolidatedBalanceSheets"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">CONSOLIDATED
BALANCE SHEETS</font></b></a></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">(In thousands,
except per share data)</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="1" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border:none;border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="71%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:71.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">

  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">106,892</font></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">The accompanying notes are an
integral part of these financial statements.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">F-2</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</font>

SYSTEM TECHNOLOGY,&nbsp;INC.</font></b></p>

<p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">The accompanying notes are an
integral part of these financial statements.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-3</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">

</font>

<p style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>

SYSTEM TECHNOLOGY,&nbsp;INC.</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">The accompanying notes are an

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-4</font></p>


<div style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">35,591</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="57%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:57.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 20.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Deferred
  compensation from common shares related to ATMOS acquisition subject to
  vesting requirements</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;font-size:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">314</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">

  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.7%;">
  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>

  exercises</font></p>

  <p align="right" style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#cceeff" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="color:windowtext;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
